instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP5V_S4RS3: What is PP5V_S4RS3? PP5V_S4RS3 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .

threads.title: Mac book air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning On , pp3v42 , <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> , available .
threads.message: i dont get <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL> ? stuck on 0.030 amps

threads.title: Mac book air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning On , pp3v42 , <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> , available .
threads.message: What voltage on PP3v42 and PPBUS? PPVRTC? <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: Mac book air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning On , pp3v42 , <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> , available .
Mac book air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning On , pp3v42 , <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> , available .
threads.message:
"PPVRTC - 0.000"
Diode mode to ground?

PCH doesn't start power on sequence if no RTC signals present.
Post <CHIP>U1900</CHIP> volatges.
Be aware at <CAPACITOR>C1910</CAPACITOR>, many times gets corroded.

threads.title: Mac book air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning On , pp3v42 , <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> , available .
threads.message: Resistance to ground on <SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL>? You're going to have an issue with that line causing no power most likely. Could be <CHIP>U1900</CHIP> or a short.

threads.title: Mac book air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning On , pp3v42 , <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> , available .
threads.message: i got nothing on <CHIP>U1900</CHIP> only on pin 1 <CAPACITOR>C1910</CAPACITOR> 2.700

threads.title: Mac book air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning On , pp3v42 , <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> , available .
threads.message:
No voltage at pins 2 & 13???

"pin 1 <CAPACITOR>C1910</CAPACITOR> 2.700"
What this means?
I asked for diode mode reading (red probe at ground)...
